questions.question: She advised me to consult a doctor.
questions.description: Here the verb has an object (me) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: Let’s invite your cousins as well.
questions.description: Here the verb has an object (cousins) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: I waited for an hour.
questions.description: Here the verb does not have an object and hence it is intransitive.

questions.question: I received your letter in the morning.
questions.description: Here the verb has an object (letter) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: I am going to send her some flowers.
questions.description: Here the verb has two objects (her and flowers) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: He has changed a lot since he got married.
questions.description: Here the verb does not have an object and hence it is intransitive.

questions.question: Suddenly the child woke up.
questions.description: Here the verb does not have an object and hence it is intransitive.

questions.question: The loud noise woke me.
questions.description: Here the verb woke has an object (me) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: Let’s discuss your plans.
questions.description: Here the verb discuss has an object (plans) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: I heard a lovely song in the morning.
questions.description: Here the verb heard has an object (song) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: Can you lend me a few pounds?
questions.description: Here the verb lend has two objects (me and pounds) and hence it is transitive.

questions.question: The wind was blowing fiercely.
questions.description: Here the verb has no object and hence it is intransitive.
